tool.name: OSMGPRemoveExtension

param.name: in_osmfeatures
param.dialogReference: The feature class from which to remove the OSM (OpenStreetMap) editor extension.
param.pythonReference: The feature class from which to remove the OSM (OpenStreetMap) editor extension.

tool.summary: The tools remove the OSM (OpenStreetMap) feature class extension from the input feature class.
tool.usage:
• If the user plans to distribute the downloaded OSM data it is recommended to remove the OSM feature class extension as only ArcGIS installations with the OSM Editor for ArcGIS can open and manipulate the data.

  • In order to engage the OSM editor behavior again, please use the Add OSM Editor Extensiongeoprocessing tool.

scriptExample.title: Remove OSM Editor Extension (Python)
scriptExample.para: The following Python window script demonstrates how to remove the OSM Editor extension from an existing feature class.
scriptExample.code:
# import the system modules import arcpy from arcpy import env
# load the OpenStreetMap specific toolbox arcpy.ImportToolbox(r'd:\projects\OSMEditor\WheelChairMap\OpenStreetMap Toolbox.tbx')
# remove the extension from an existing feature class # set the workspace where the current feature class exists env.workspace = r'd:\projects\OSMEditor\WheelChairMap\default_storage.gdb'
arcpy.OSMGPRemoveExtension_osmtools(r'stuttgart\stuttgart_osm_pt')

dataIdInfo.idAbs: The tools remove the OSM (OpenStreetMap) feature class extension from the input feature class.
